intro: Aneilema smithii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen herb, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including pink, purple, and white, making it a favorite among gardeners.
